items.preText: 10.55am Readers and fans from the US, if you are done watching the PSL highlights here, you can watch this ODI LIVE here, on ESPN+. We're only a few minuted away. The openers have walked out, the fielders are taking their positions and Matt Henry is assessing his run up. And Taki Taki on the speakers again. Two slips for Tamim, here we go... My colleague Isam believes: "Vishal, I think the most vital part for Bangladesh is going to be how their top three respond today. They didn't have a great game collectively in Napier, so it is time that they assess the situation a little better. Particularly, Soumya Sarkar, who threw it away after starting well in the last game." 10.50am I wonder if Bangladesh would have thought of making any changes today, not often you see the winning side making a change and the losing side going unchanged. Rubel Hossain would have been a good prospect in such conditions, he has good pace and has been in good form in the BPL. Not to forget, this is going to be Mushfiqur Rahim's 200th ODI. Fahad: "No idea why Bangladesh not playing rubel he's been in very good form recently conclude BPL plus he's got some pace to hurry the batsman" Saleque Sufi: "Grassy wicket, cloud cover ,Rubel not there . Can not imagine the game plan of Bangladesh " kranthi: "What is the pitch like? batting friendly?" Looked more batting-friendly that the Napier track, but it's overcast today so you never know with this NZ pace attack. Toss: New Zealand have opted to bowl Kane Williamson: An early start so good to bowl here. One change: Todd Astle comes in for Mitchell Santner Mashrafe Mortaza: We'd have liked to bowl first as well, still looks like a good track to bat on. I think our bowlers have been doing alright, it's our batsmen today who have to do well. We have the same team. Rahul : "Bangladesh have never won a match against New Zealand in New Zealand in any format, am I right??" You are, very much Aman Haque: "For a brittle BD batting, foregoing the Gung-Ho approach in the first powerplay might be good for them." bkrip: "No Rubel?? Has he fallen out of favor with Mortaza? Would think BD need a penetrative bowler like Rubel to take wickets." Rhys: "Looks pretty gloomy here in Christchurch, but the forecast says that it should clear up this afternoon" Saleque Sufi: "Well a do or die match for Bangladesh . Hope Bangladesh appears with right combination and right frame of mind and a proper game plan. I still feel they can turn around " 10.30am Still pretty overcast out there, about 16 degrees and 71% humidity, the crowd is still filling in. Simon Doull at the pitch report says there's just a bit of grass on what looks like a flat pitch, so it might grip a bit. He says the team winning the toss should bowl first. 10.15am Oh we have good news already - the covers are coming off, the players have started stretching and looks like it might still be an 11am start. Bangladesh will be desperate to turn their form around this match, it's only a three-match series, so no more time left. Their batting and shot selection will be in focus, in particular, as they will probably face another pace test. Here's more in Isam's preview. New Zealand, meanwhile, may not have as much to worry about after Martin Guptill and Henry Nicholls put on a century stand. But with easier batting conditions expected in Christchurch today, will they be able to pose as big a threat if Bangladesh bat second? "Hello Vishal, I was hoping to fall asleep after watching first 10-15 overs. I had better get back to bed." Hang on, kranthi. don't switch off the light yet 10.10am Hello everyone! Good morning to those in New Zealand, very early good morning to those in Bangladesh and good day to the rest across the world. It's time for the second ODI in Christchurch but we have some bad news for now - the covers are on at the Hagley Oval because of the rain but it could get better from here. Might be a delayed start so we'll keep you posted.
items.text: starts with a length delivery around off, confident little forward lean from Tamim to block it
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: pulls this one a tad shorter and swings it in too, troubles Tamim with the bounce as that hits him in the abdomen
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 132.6kmh, back of length around off again, this time he stays back and defends nicely
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: towards the leg side again, he tries to tuck it fine but gets a leg bye for now
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, 1 leg bye

items.text: 134.4kmh, just back of length and angling in towards middle and leg, he defends it towards midwicket
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, no run

items.text: little straighter on middle stumps and he defends it back
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, no run

items.preText:
News just coming in: The Knights will have Tim Southee and Mitchell Santner available for tomorrow's Super Smash final against Central Stags at Seddon Park in Hamilton. The two Northern Districts players have been released from the ODI squad for today's match. The two Northern Districts stars have been released from the BLACKCAPS ODI squad for today's match against Bangladesh in Christchurch.

Trent Boult from the other end
items.text: nice shape straightaway, swinging it away from Tamim outside off, he leans into it and drives into the covers
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: hint of outswing as the length is pulled back a bit and Tamim shoulders arms this time
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: mixes it up with a bouncer, Tamim ducks under it pretty early
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: on length just outside off, nice seam position for the outswing, Tami blocks it back with a straight bat
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 137.3kmh, hurries him up a little by banging it shorter and little wider, Tamim defends from the top half of his bat while taking a hand off
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: beats him on the last ball. Good shape to swing the ball, pitches it on good length outside off and it makes Tamim poke and miss off the back foot
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of length outside off, he steers it late towards third man
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, 1 run

items.preText: prasu: "Boult will be itching to bowl at Right Handers, with ball coming in, especially after his performance vs India in 4th odi"
items.text: on middle and off, no movement and Tamim closes the face of the bat to tuck it to leg
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 135.3kmh, here comes the bouncer from Henry. Tamim watches and sways away from the line of the ball to let it go
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: watches it late and defends the length ball around off into the off side
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: there was a sound as the ball is put down by Latham down the leg side. It's called a wide though
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, 1 wide

items.text: run-out chance and Tamim survives because of a wayward throw from Williamson at cover! He pushed the length ball into the covers and wanted a run that didn't exist, he was sent back and could have been dismissed had the captain sent the ball in towards the keeper, and not make him dive with that throw to his right
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: more on the leg side and it's tucked off the pads towards square leg for two
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: that's an excellent catch running towards the boundary from Lockie Ferguson. Boult has struck early again and will Liton be happy with that shot? Came down the track and lofted that pretty high on the leg side with a straight bat, but he hardly got anything on that to get the distance he would have liked. Ferguson from mid-on runs back towards the boundary and does just enough to get both hands to it without having to put in a dive
items.shortText: Boult to Liton Das, OUT

dismissal.text: Liton Das c Ferguson b Boult 1 (12m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25.00

items.text: pushes him on the back foot with that length and he defends it close to himself
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: and opens him up a little this time with the swing after pitching it on middle and off, swings away just a hint and Tamim gets a thick outside edge to third man
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: tries the yorker first up to Soumya, it's just a tad inaccurate towards the leg and he flicks it away just behind square, almost losing his balance. They decide to come back for the second as the fielder doesn't chase it at full speed
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs

items.text: much shorter on the leg side this time, tucked away more confidently for one towards long leg
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: pretty accurate on the off stump, no room whatsoever, and he defends it to leg for a quick single
items.postText: There's a drizzle around now, not too heavy though
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run
